newsitem.title: USA: Hasbro offers Internet versions of classic games.
newsitem.headline: Hasbro offers Internet versions of classic games.

text.p: Hasbro Inc is bringing some of its more popular board games to cyberspace.

Consumers who have bought Hasbro's CD-ROM games, such as Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk and Battleship, will soon be able to find opponents and to compete over the Internet by using Microsoft Corp Internet Gaming Zone, a soon-to-be-launched Web site.

"This represents a major breakthrough for everyone who owns a PC because it enables them to play the games they know and love against others without having to worry about extra fees or cumbersome technology," Hasbro President Tom Dusenberry said in a statement.
The Hasbro games are to be available on the site this summer.
Aside from game-playing with opponents, the site will feature real-time, online chat rooms, allowing players to banter while playing.
